item.title: Report X-2023020748
item.description:
Report X-2023020748

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-25T09:10:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-14
  • City: RAPID CITY
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found during normal sort operations at our station location in Rapid city South Dakota. When offered to the clean up specialist, the package was found to consist of a fibreboard box there was brown paper on the bottom of the box and a plastic gallon jug inside. the commodity was Kiwo On Press Cleaner. When the employee viewed the label he became aware of a Flammable GHS label and obtained an SDS which states the flash point of the product is 40Â°c. and should be classified as UN 1263 packing group III. There were no marks nor labels on the package which indicated there was flammable liquid inside. Package was placed in a plastic moisture barrier and contained in a steel salvage package and is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023010516
item.description:
Report X-2023010516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T21:09:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-09
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023010516 UNLOADER NOTICED CORROSIVE BOX LEAKING ON FLOOR OF TRAILER, DID NOT TOUCH, NOTIFIED SUP. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO SPILL IN FULL PPE, SMALL PUDDLE ON FLOOR OF TRAILER. RESPONDER REMOVED PKG FROM TRAILER, NEUTRILIZED THE LIQUID AND THEN SOLIDIFIED IT. CLEANED UP TRAILER WITH APPROPRIATE BROOM AND DUSTPAN AND TRANSFERED MATERIAL TO SERVICE CENTER. OUTSIDE RESPONDER CALLED FOR PICK UP. 2. X-2023010517 UNLOADER NOTICED CORROSIVE BOX LEAKING ON FLOOR OF TRAILER, DID NOT TOUCH, NOTIFIED SUP. RESPONDER REMOVED PKG FROM TRAILER, NEUTRILIZED THE LIQUID AND THEN SOLIDIFIED IT. CLEANED UP TRAILER WITH APPROPRIATE BROOM AND DUSTPAN AND TRANSFERED MATERIAL TO SERVICE CENTER. OUTSIDE RESPONDER CALLED FOR PICK UP. 3. X-2023010518 UNLOADER NOTICED CORROSIVE BOX LEAKING ON FLOOR OF TRAILER, DID NOT TOUCH, NOTIFIED SUP. RESPONDER REMOVED PKG FROM TRAILER, NEUTRILIZED THE LIQUID AND THEN SOLIDIFIED IT. CLEANED UP TRAILER WITH APPROPRIATE BROOM AND DUSTPAN AND TRANSFERED MATERIAL TO SERVICE CENTER.

item.description:
Report X-2023010135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T21:09:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: HURON
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BOX ON THE ROLLERS LEAKED A SOLID MATERIAL AND RESPONDER WAS CALLED. UPON OPENING THE BOX IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LABELED AS A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL ON THE INTERNAL PACKAGING. THE BAG THE MATERIAL WAS IN TORE OPEN CAUSING THE LEAK. THE BOX WAS PADDED WITH CRAFT PAPPER. HAZMAT HELP DESK CONTACTED UNDECLARED DISCOVERED AND HELP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2022120726
item.description:
Report E-2022120726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T21:09:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-19
  • City: TEA
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 19, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured during trasnit and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer floor and other pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew GeoTek Engineering & Testing Services, Inc. (GETS) to remediate the impacted surface. GETS personnel utilized granular absorbents and scheduled to return at a later date. On December 20, 2022, GETS personnel returned to the site. The crew used a forklift to remove the remaining contents from the damaged tote into a new 330-gallon tote. Personnel then deployed more absorbents and worked them n using hand tools. All undamaged cargo was repalletized and all UN3265-impacted material was containerized in the damaged 330-gallon tote for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120619
item.description:
Report E-2022120619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T21:09:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-19
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XSO contacted ERTS to report an estimated 2-gallon release of regulated UN3266 corrosive liquid that was released from a poly drum after arriving at the terminal. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of Micro-Kleen LNP (AFCO 4407) released to an 8' x 20' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. The impacted absorbents and all other cleanup debris were containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110006
item.description:
Report E-2022110006

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-24T21:09:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-25
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0950 ET, XPO Logistics reported a spill in Sioux Falls, SD. XPO advised that due to improper loading bottles of UN3266 ZEP Industrial Purple Degreaser & Cleaner in a box fell from the top of the pallet causing a 0.5 gallon release onto the packaging of the bottles. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response to conduct cleanup. At 1520 ET, HMR personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released from a box containing four 1-gallon poly jugs. The material impacted the packaging only. The damaged jug, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
